website_summaries.verdict: This core bit features an integral shank for better power transmission. It also, however, tends to throw a bit of dust and debris.
pros: Integral shank provides better power transmissions and lets smaller hammers make larger holes
Dust and debris filter out the bottom, away from hands
cons: Generates a bit of debris, so be sure to have a water supply nearby

customer_reviews.title: It works great on brick
customer_reviews.text: I had 26 holes to cut into a brick veneer to install boxes for light fixtures. This tool has made short work of that task and left me with a clean hole to set the boxes into. Average time to cut the 4" brick was less than 3 minutes each, and the holes were smooth and clean. You'll have to stop before penetrating the back of the brick and break the core to go all the way through,though.
customer_reviews.author: gotcha6

customer_reviews.title: Did the job...
customer_reviews.text: I needed a bit for a dryer vent to go through a concrete foundation. It made light work of this job but very expensive for a 1 time use.
customer_reviews.author: DelBoy

customer_reviews.title: Drilling dryer vents made easy
customer_reviews.text: I only used this bit to drill 2 dryer vent holes, but it went through brick and cinderblock like butter.
customer_reviews.author: @pinzgauer

customer_reviews.title: ... the first time and it went through the brick nicely. Be careful however that your pilot hole matches ...
customer_reviews.text: Used it recently for the first time and it went through the brick nicely. Be careful however that your pilot hole matches up with the arbor bit on the core drill. The weight of the bit tends to pull it down as you drill. The bit is long also so it will go all the way through the depth of most brick walls. I haven't used the bit for long so I can't comment on how long it will last.
customer_reviews.author: ebuttah

customer_reviews.title: Great
customer_reviews.text: Fast shipping, arrived as described, fit my Bosch hammer and got the job done.
customer_reviews.author: Lehua

customer_reviews.title: Tough bit... use it every day on ...
customer_reviews.text: Tough bit... use it every day on concrete, bricks, cinder blocks. Lasts well so far - over a year use. More than 100 hole done. Use with makita and hilti 13-14 amps
customer_reviews.author: Andrey Andreev

customer_reviews.title: my HF drill was able to core an 8" poured concrete wall using this 4" bosch bit
customer_reviews.text: my HF drill was able to core an 8" poured concrete wall using this 4" bosch bit
customer_reviews.author: sean lavellle

customer_reviews.title: First Rate Boring Bit.
customer_reviews.text: Only had to bore two 4" holes through a CMU wall, but at an annoying height from ground. Used in a Hilti TE 56, this bit cut through rapidly. Very happy with purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Jon E. Dill

customer_reviews.title: Excellent
customer_reviews.text: I have used the bit to install dryer vent piping in existing concrete foundations. This is a tool I would recommend be sure to have a water supply as it generates a great deal of dust when cutting.
customer_reviews.author: Richard Woodward

customer_reviews.title: Works great
customer_reviews.text: Cuts though anything, i have used for about 20 holes so far and feels like new, paid for its self
customer_reviews.author: cesar

customer_reviews.title: Works great through block
customer_reviews.text: I bought this bit to drill through concrete block. It worked like a hot knife through skin. The only change I would make to the design is to add a slot to push the material out of the bit.
customer_reviews.author: Ronald Matten

customer_reviews.title: ... I have bought this bit before and it performs pretty well.
customer_reviews.text: the last one i purchased had the teeth break off after only one hr of use but all in all I have bought this bit before and it performs pretty well.
customer_reviews.author: Ben Murphy

customer_reviews.title: Good bit
customer_reviews.text: Works great but must put tape around pin so it won't flyout
customer_reviews.author: randy

customer_reviews.title: 5 star
customer_reviews.text: Cut through cinder block and 80 yr old brick like butter
customer_reviews.author: Iconic e.

customer_reviews.title: Great bit!
customer_reviews.text: This bit cuts very well! Went through block ... Or should I say eat it up!! Fast!
customer_reviews.author: Joel

customer_reviews.title: Best price, best shipping
customer_reviews.text: Does the job perfectly. Poured concrete foundation or block, right through it. Had the product delivered in less time than I thought it would take. And I couldn't find a better price.
customer_reviews.author: Charliedoggo

customer_reviews.title: No problem going through concrete floor took only a couple ...
customer_reviews.text: No problem going through concrete floor took only a couple minutes to cut depth of bit highly advise buying this core bit.
customer_reviews.author: Tim H.

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Perfect tool for the project. A little water as we drilled right through at a steady pace
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great price
customer_reviews.text: This is exactly what I was looking for. Great price too
customer_reviews.author: Julie calderon

customer_reviews.title: amazing, will buy more
customer_reviews.text: Fu#@&ng amazing...went through the concrete like butta yo. Loud as hell, have your ear plugs handy. yada yada yada yada
customer_reviews.author: martin e newville

customer_reviews.title: mine broke immediately
customer_reviews.text: mine broke after just a few uses. the shaft broke off right where it joins the actual core. it had been used only a couple of times. the teeth look brand new. it says made in Germany so I assume this is just a bad luck situation. when you look at the broken shaft it is obvious there was a defect in the metal. I bought another and so far it has not broken.
customer_reviews.author: Brent L

customer_reviews.title: USELESS.  Breaks right away.  piece of shaft now jammed in my new Hilti roto hammer.
customer_reviews.text: After 25 years and thousands of 4" holes drilled I finally broke a core bit. Thought it was a fluke purchased another and broke that one too. Unfortunately a part of the shaft is now jammed in my new Hilti roto hammer. In fairness I have never used a one piece core bit. Maybe they"re all this way. Out almost five hundred for the 2 bits and my hammer needs service and I still need a core bit. Upset Contractor
customer_reviews.author: dennis bender

customer_reviews.title: that's what's up
customer_reviews.text: exactly as described, makes quick and precise hole. Not just a time saver. hope i was "helpful"
customer_reviews.author: Kevin Easter

customer_reviews.title: Previous reviewer does not understand this bit. Solid performer
customer_reviews.text: Previous reviewer's information on this bit is incorrect. This bit is a designed to be used in a rotary hammer, not a chisel. It works very well at this job - won't cut through rebar (the carbide teeth catch in it, and you may damage the bit if you really try to push through it), but through any kind of masonry (I've used it on concrete, block, and brick) it moves very quickly and leaves extremely clean holes. No blowout in brick at all, great for making clean vent holes, etc.
customer_reviews.author: Martin Taylor

product_meta.title: Bosch 4-Inch x 17-Inch x 22-Inch SDS Max Rotary Hammer Core Bit HC8555
product_meta.description:
Bosch SDS-max carbide-tipped rotary hammer core bits offer an integral shank for better power transmission. Bosch SDS-max rotary hammer core bits with wave design go beyond the range of standard bits and allow smaller hammers to drill larger holes. Wave design transfers energy to bit more effectively for up to 40 percent faster drilling versus previous design. Only for use with SDS-Max rotary hammers.

AMAZON.COM
Bosch HC8555 core bits with wave design go beyond the range of standard bits and allow smaller hammers to drill larger holes. Bosch SDS-Max rotary hammer core bits are carbide tipped with an integral shank for better power transmission. Maximum core size is 2-5/8-inch deep.
feature_bullets: EFFICIENT: The Bosch SDS-max carbide-tipped rotary hammer core bit features an effective wave design to transfer energy for up to 40 percent speedier drilling versus other bit designs.
POWER: With an integral shank, the HC8555 offers better power transmission and is designed to allow smaller hammers to drill larger holes.
VERSATILE: This core bit is versatile in application with materials including concrete, brick, and block.
DIMENSIONS: The Bosch HC8555 SDS-max core cutter measures 4-inches in diameter. The useable length is 17-inches and the overall length is 22-inches.
Only for use with SDS-max rotary hammers
The bit diameter is 4 inches, and the shank diameter is 0.71 inches.
